channel.title: Paul Heires' Github Site
channel.description: Recent content on Paul Heires' Github Site

item.title: What Major League Baseball statistic defines a championship winning team?
item.description: If you’ve ever been to a major league baseball game, you know that home runs are one of the best parts of the game. They’re fun to watch, and often times the team with the most homers wins the game. The long ball doesn’t always tell the whole story though. Of the MLB champions in the last 15 seasons, only 5 have ranked in the top 8 in home runs during the regular season.

item.title: How do upsets in the 2021 NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament compare to the rest of March Madness History?
item.description: There seemed to have been quite a few big upsets in this year’s NCAA Men’s Basketball March Madness tournament, but they don’t call it March Madness for nothing. There usually is a decent amount of top teams going home earlier than they wanted to, anticipated to, and were projected to. So how surprised, or upset should we really be? Shouldn’t we expect this to happen? Let’s take a look.

item.title: College Football Text Cleaning
item.description: Today, Let’s take a look at the biggest College Football Blowouts in the 2019-2020 season. THe first thing I am going to need is the tidyverse and ggalt libraries. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.5 ✓ dplyr 1.0.3 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.

item.title: Sports Data Analysis and Visualization
item.description: This is my sports data Analysis and Visualization project for Matt Waite’s SPMC 350 class in the College of Journalism and Mass Communications in the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.
